intro: Lecostomon crassipes var. cayennense, commonly known as the Cayenne lecostomon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along riverbanks. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
